item.title: [GROOVY-232] inherited invokeMethod does not work
item.description:
this groovy file fails on the last line. 'new A().duh()' works, but 'new B().duh()' does not work.

=== here is the file ===

class A {
invokeMethod(String name, Object args) {
try

{ metaClass.invokeMethod(this, name, args) }

catch(MissingMethodException e) {
println "Missing method: ${name}"
}
}
}
class B extends A {
}

new A().duh()
new B().duh()

comments.comment: should be fairly easy to fix - we should only auto-generate the invokeMethod if there's not one defined in the base class

Added your test case to src/test/groovy/bugs/OverloadInvokeMethodBug.groovy.
